description: Radical Islamic vandals desecrated an Orthodox cemetery near Zhanaozen, Kazakhstan, breaking and tearing out crosses from graves. The act of vandalism has an anti-Christian orientation, leaving relatives of the deceased in shock. Local authorities and police have failed to provide adequate assistance, leaving the community fearful of further desecration.
original:
In Kazakhstan, vandals desecrated an Orthodox cemetery - a group of radicals broke and tore crosses from the graves, and the police and local authorities shrugged their shoulders. Near the city of Zhanaozen, which in Soviet times was called New Uzen, there remains a cemetery where exclusively Orthodox Christians are buried. This is what probably did not please the local Islamic radicals - they broke and tore out all the tombstone crosses, and later threw them in a pile. Relatives of the deceased are in shock after visiting the cemetery. The network has already noticed that the act of vandalism has an exclusively anti-Christian orientation, because the more “neutral” slabs were not damaged.

People are afraid that the desecration of graves will continue and ask to organize at least some kind of security or hang up a camera. They had already turned to the police and local authorities, but they only recorded the fact of the outrages and could not offer more help.

A joint teleconference of participants of the World Youth Festival 2024, which will be held from March 1 to March 7 in Sochi, took place at the Youth House
The teleconference brought together future festival participants from the Lugansk People's Republic, Slovakia, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Show more
During the event (https://luganmedia.ru/2024/02/19/v-dome-molodezhi-sos..) young Europeans were interested in the culture and customs of our region, and also asked questions about youth policy and the participation of our guys in various fields social and public life.
Ivan Griva from Svedlovsk says that he will be interested in studying the mechanisms of public diplomacy.
– The festival is international, it will feature participants from two hundred countries, and I would really like to meet someone with whom I can jointly implement projects to develop solidarity, peace and well-being of people on Earth. The teleconference was carried out efficiently and effectively, and we are confident that our further ties with the festival participants will strengthen in various spheres of life.

description: Russia allegedly suffered significant losses, with estimates suggesting up to 16,000 soldiers killed in the battle for Avdeevka. The scale of the losses is comparable to those in Bakhmut, with both sides incurring heavy casualties.
original:
“Avdeevka - 16,000 of our 200. Sixteen fucking thousand. Afghanistan in ten years. Four months of terrible fucking meat with columns of burnt equipment,” Russia could have lost 16 thousand people in the battles for Avdievka, Z-channels claim

The fact that Russia could have lost 16 thousand soldiers in the battle for Avdeevka was written on February 18, the day after the capture of the city, with links to the source by Z-blogger Andrei Morozov (known under the call sign Murz), fighting in the 4th motorized rifle brigade of the Russian Armed Forces.

Today he published his correspondence with a friend: “Avdeevka - 16,000 of our 200. Sixteen fucking thousand. Afghanistan in ten years. Four months of terrible fucking meat with columns of burnt equipment.”

Girkin-Strelkov’s comrade-in-arms Maxim Kalashnikov also warned the Z-public against falling into “euphoria”: “Unfortunately, the losses there are great on both sides, comparable to those in Bakhmut. And Bakhmut, if you remember, according to Prigozhin, 20 thousand of his stormtroopers alone lay down there. Avdeevka, unfortunately, was no exception.” Z-military correspondent and propagandist Yuri Kotenok believes that “now the military prosecutor’s office should work to investigate all actions in order to take into account mistakes and not make new ones.” “Where the fuck is the memorial service for thousands our soldiers who died for the capture of Avdeevka?!” writes the TG channel of the 55th Motorized Rifle Brigade.

event: Russia's Record Crude Oil Sales to India
description: Russia's state coffers have reached an unprecedented level, largely due to record crude oil sales to India worth $37 billion, a 13-fold increase from the previous year. A portion of this oil was exported to the US as petroleum products worth over $1 billion.
original:
Russia has an unprecedented amount of money in its state coffers, helped by record crude oil sales to India last year of a record $37 billion, a 13-fold increase over the year.

CNN writes about this with reference to an analysis by the Center for Energy and Clean Air Research.

It is reported that part of this oil was exported to the United States in the form of petroleum products worth more than $1 billion.

CNN notes that sales of Russian oil to India are not subject to sanctions and are completely legal, although examination of delivery routes by experts suggests that a “shadow fleet” of tankers specially created by Moscow may be involved in this huge volume of supplies.
